content.body: This is generally where we discuss webidl stuff, yeah
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: This is generally where we discuss webidl stuff, yeah

content.body: Or just in the issue tracker itself, which is probably better for a design discussion like what you seem to be talking about
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Or just in the issue tracker itself, which is probably better for a design discussion like what you seem to be talking about

content.body: How are we using the "impacts documentation" label? Should the label be removed after fixing MDN? (I guess maybe not, since MDN is probably not the only interested party for documentation)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: How are we using the "impacts documentation" label? Should the label be removed after fixing MDN? (I guess maybe not, since MDN is probably not the only interested party for documentation)

content.body: Should there be a separate "needs edits on MDN" label?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Should there be a separate "needs edits on MDN" label?

content.body: yeah, I use/follow the “impacts documentation” label to keep track of changes that will require updates to MDN
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: yeah, I use/follow the “impacts documentation” label to keep track of changes that will require updates to MDN

content.body: in theory it could affect other docs, but in practice I don’t know of any docs affected other than MDN
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: in theory it could affect other docs, but in practice I don’t know of any docs affected other than MDN

content.body: and personally I have never removed that label from anything, even after changes to MDN have been made
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: and personally I have never removed that label from anything, even after changes to MDN have been made

content.body: IMHO we don’t need a separate "needs edits on MDN" label, because that’s what "impacts documentation" already is in practice
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: IMHO we don’t need a separate "needs edits on MDN" label, because that’s what "impacts documentation" already is in practice

content.body: ok. so leaving the label means there may be closed issues with the label that still needs MDN edits, and some that don't
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: ok. so leaving the label means there may be closed issues with the label that still needs MDN edits, and some that don't

content.body: (incidentally, note that we also have the @whatwg/documentation team that can be Cc’d on issues and PRs)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: (incidentally, note that we also have the @whatwg/documentation team that can be Cc’d on issues and PRs)

content.body: Removing the label seems nice though since then 0 closed issues with the label = good code health
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Removing the label seems nice though since then 0 closed issues with the label = good code health

content.body: one wrinkle in general is that somebody would need to remember to actually remove the label
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: one wrinkle in general is that somebody would need to remember to actually remove the label

content.body: The documentation team can have a regular triage of closed issues
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The documentation team can have a regular triage of closed issues

content.body: yeah I would certainly be happy to participate in that
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: yeah I would certainly be happy to participate in that
